title: Understanding the Function and Graph
text: $$/lim(x$$ , -2**+, f(x)) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-2$$ from the right. Locate $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-2$$ on the graph and observe the values of f(x) from the right.\n##figure2.gif##

title: Finding the Limit
text: What value is f(x) approaching when $$x$$ approaches $$-2$$ from the right? If the limit is $$\infty$$, write $$-\infty$$ or $$+\infty$$. If the limit does not exist, write 'DNE'.

title: Limit Value
text: $$/lim(x$$ ,-2**+, f(x)) $$=$$ $$+\infty$$. Looking at the right side of the function as $$x$$ approaches $$-2$$, we can see that the values of f(x) continuously goes up into the positives.\n##figure3.gif##
